What do you use for your autonomous routines? I want to switch from Pathplanner to Choreo. Would it make sense? As far as I know, it has the same features as Pathplanner, but Choreo offers more optimized paths. If anyone has used Choreo, what are your experiences?

  • Pathplanner
  • Choreo
  • Custom Pathfinder
  • Wpilib Trajectory Generator

So should I just use this or should I combine it with something like pathplanner and choreo again? Because if I try to use just this type of system, it might hit some obstacles.

Could you please elaborate?

","post_number":4,"post_type":1,"posts_count":6,"updated_at":"2025-03-27T21:07:29.644Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":2,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":173,"readers_count":172,"score":34.6,"yours":false,"topic_id":497145,"topic_slug":"what-do-you-use-for-autonomous","display_username":"Dan Katzuv","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","reply_to_user":{"id":33408,"username":"Smtopps","name":"Smtopps","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/smtopps/{size}/166758_2.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":32004,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"5987 Software Mentor ðŸ‡®ðŸ‡±"},"post_url":"/t/what-do-you-use-for-autonomous/497145/4","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3570615,"name":"Smtopps","username":"Smtopps","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/smtopps/{size}/166758_2.png","created_at":"2025-03-27T22:38:18.927Z","cooked":"

So thereâ€™s a lot to consider. We have used pathplanner, choreo, and Drive To Pose autos. Iâ€™m personally a fan of all of them. PathPlanner has been a huge part to our performance over the past few years. As of Newmarket we still used it for running all our paths/auto routines. We used choreo for making the paths starting in the 2024 offseason and made the autos in pathplanner since you can create auto routines using choreo paths. Overall though you can probably use either with similar effectiveness.

One thing about path following. We found some inaccuracies that may have been due to another issue we recently discovered. When each choreo paths end we used PID controllers to drive field relative to the specific branch.

There when it switches from path planning to the PID there is a slight delay since the robot stops for the path. Then the PID needs to accelerate again. This was the main reason we switched to fully PID driven autos.

So our auto for the north bay event is made up of a few methods/commands compositions. First we have a method that drives and places on a branch. It PID drives to a specified branch. And when we are within a certain range of the target it will start raising the elevator and get everything in position. It only shoots the coral when everything is within range (elevator within tolerance, arm within tolerance, drivebase in position). Another method drives to the center of the loading station and starts intaking instantly. It has a deadline so when we intake a coral it moves on the next step immediately. If we need to avoid an obstacle we have a transition waypoint which starts driving to a specific pose but has a large tolerance. This means we start driving to the next step before the PID Controllers had the opportunity to slow down. We only use this after the first reef face going to the loading station to avoid hitting the reef. This is the actual auto

github.com

HoyaRobotics/4152Reefscape2025/blob/main/src/main/java/frc/robot/commands/Autos/Coral3Piece.java

import frc.robot.constants.FieldConstants.Reef;
import frc.robot.constants.FieldConstants.Side;
import frc.robot.subsystems.algaeIntake.AlgaeIntake;
import frc.robot.subsystems.drive.Drive;
import frc.robot.subsystems.intake.Intake;
import frc.robot.subsystems.superstructure.SuperStructure;
import frc.robot.subsystems.superstructure.SuperStructure.SuperStructurePose;
import java.util.function.Supplier;

public class Coral3Piece extends PoserAuto {
